titleStmt.title: Despatch from M. A. Aenmey to William Hunter, April 26, 1882

bibl.title: Despatch from M. A. Aenmey to William Hunter
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: Second Assistant U.S. Secretary of State

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States
Monrovia April 26th 1882
Mr M. A Aenmey to the Second Assist Secry of State

Consulate General of the United States
Monrovia April 26th 1882
I have the honor respectfully to submit my quarterly returns and accounts for the third quarter, ending March 31st 1882.
The office rent is quoted in the account as mem for rasons explained in my dispatch to the Department marked No 6, having recived no reply since from the parties concerned
The bill as pr voucher No 3 was left unpaid by the late minister H. H. Garnet and presented to me for payment.

The expences as pr voucher No 4 I was compelled to make, the two doors of the office room being at the time of death of the late Minister Garnet in such a condition, that no key nither lock or any fastenings prevented the entrance in to the office.
Please to find enclosed for the dept the following

1 Digest of Invoice book
2 Arrivals and departure of American vessels
3 Rent and miscellaneous expences with vouchers
div1.fw:
Hon Second Assist Secy of State
Washington D.C.
div1.p: Trusting this accounts will meet the approval of the Department.

I am Sir
with sentiments of distinguished consideration
Your obedt servt
M A Aenmey
Act. Consul General.

1 Digest of Invoice book
2 Arrivals and departures of American vessels
3 Rent and Miscellaneous expences with vouchers.
